instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
Hello,
I have this board with a graphic issue, see examples attached. When I play a video it's worse, I see just a blinking white display with some colour spots.
Do you have by any chance A BIOS which use only the internal graphic? Maybe the internal is still good?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
Hardware mod has already been posted on the forum.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jrLkrtVJcb-FgI3FXOqgBZwcABhpMlpb/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
Just in case...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
Woow... thank you, this sounds interesting to do! I will try.
I also noticed that on internal display the image is ok, even with video playing; it starts to distort when I force dedicated GPU.
When I look at the block diagram page 2, I understand that mini display port should also use internal and dedicated GPU, through <CHIP>U9390</CHIP> DP/T29 MUX. Why I don't have a clear image on external display then? Is it possible that this MUX is blocked to dedicated GPU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message: External monitor is driven by discrete graphics (GPU).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
Thanks for the information.
I completed the mod today, it was perfect for a rainy Sunday! I passed my microsolderer exam, it works :D Thanks again for the information.
Just to clarify about this mod: it was originally for 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (I see L8920)? Then can I use these pictures to modify a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, or there are some steps differents/ to add?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
For <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> remove <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> and use solution from this photo + remove <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> after soldering wires. Some say you can leave <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> but I always remove it.

For High Sierra you will also need to make jumper between pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C9711</CAPACITOR>, otherwise after closing and opening the lid there will be no image.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
Too much work, disable 2915 in BIOS with Medusa, or flash GMUX.
Best way, use Tiresias GPUkiller; that preserves real backligh adjust.

BTW, flashing GMUX is the fastest; no need to remove MLB from case.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
Thank you both.
I never flashed GMUX, I saw another post about that, so I will first get a  Lattice HW-USBN-2A programmer, then I will open another post because for sure I will need you support!
